block.p: Meredith Alicia Davis, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warren Bagley Davis of Larchmont, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Nicholas Andrew Brawer, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Allen Brawer of New York. The Rev. Walter Kenny performed the ceremony at St. Augustine's Roman Catholic Church.

Mrs. Brawer, 25, was until November a cataloger trainee in the furniture department at Sotheby's, the auction house, in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Wellesley College. Her father is a retired information technology consultant in Larchmont.

Meredith Alicia Davis, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warren Bagley Davis of Larchmont, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Nicholas Andrew Brawer, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Allen Brawer of New York. The Rev. Walter Kenny performed the ceremony at St. Augustine's Roman Catholic Church.

Mrs. Brawer, 25, was until November a cataloger trainee in the furniture department at Sotheby's, the auction house, in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Wellesley College. Her father is a retired information technology consultant in Larchmont.

Mr. Brawer, 31, is a decorative arts historian, whose book, ''British Campaign Furniture: Elegance Under Canvas, 1740 to 1914,'' is to be published next year by Harry N. Abrams. He graduated from Columbia University and received a master's degree in art history from the Courtauld Institute of Art in London.

His father retired as the chief executive of Maidenform, the lingerie manufacturer in Bayonne, N.J., which was founded by Ida and William Rosenthal, great-grandparents of the bridegroom. The bridegroom's mother, Catherine Brawer, is the president of the Ida and William Rosenthal Foundation in New York, a philanthropy for social services, education and the arts.
